tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 和人地は、近世の北海道における地域区分のひとつ。
sen.e: Wajinchi is an area division in Hokkaido in the early-modern history.
Wajinchi is an area division in Hokkaido in the early-modern times.
Wajinchi is an area division in Hokkaido in the early-modern times.

sen.j: 蝦夷と呼ばれるアイヌが居住する蝦夷地に対して、もっぱら和人（日本人）が居住する渡島半島南端の一帯を指した。
sen.e: Conpared with the area which was called Ezo where ainu lived, Wajinchi referred to the area which was the whole area of southern end of Watari-shima island (Hokkaido) where Wajin (Japanese) were living.
Compared with the area which was called Ezo where ainu lived, Wajinchi referred to the area which was the whole area of southern end of Oshima Peninsula, where Wajin (Japanese) were living.
sen.cmt: Conpared→Compared,スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。「渡島半島」を修正しました。
sen.e: Compared with the area which was called Ezo where ainu lived, Wajinchi referred to the area which was the whole area of southern end of Oshima Peninsula, where Wajin (Japanese) were living.

sen.j: 渡島半島の南端にはアイヌ文化成立の前段階である擦文時代には擦文文化と本州土師器文化の間に生じたクレオール的文化である青苗文化が成立していた。
sen.e: In the southern end of Watari-shima peninsula, Aobue culture had been established. Aobue culture is the Creole stile culture, which was produced between Satsumon culture and Honshu (main island of Japn) Haji ware culture in the age of Satsumon corresponding to the preceding stage of Ainu culture production.

In the southern end of Oshima Peninsula in the Satsumon era, corresponding to the preceding stage of the Ainu culture establishment, the Aonae culture had been established, which was the Creole style culture, produced between Satsumon culture and Honshu (main island of Japan) Haji ware culture.
sen.cmt: 「渡島半島」、「青苗文化」を修正しました。ピリオドで分割されている二文を一つにしました。stile→style,Japn→Japan,スペースの修正、カンマを補い、文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: In the southern end of Oshima Peninsula in the Satsumon era, corresponding to the preceding stage of the Ainu culture establishment, the Aonae culture had been established, which was the Creole style culture, produced between Satsumon culture and Honshu (main island of Japan) Haji ware culture.

sen.j: この文化を足がかりにここに和人の移住定着が起こった。
sen.e: Using this culture as a foothold, movement and settlement of Wajin began.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Using this culture as a foothold, the movement and settlement of Wajin began.
Using this culture as a foothold, the movement and settlement of Wajin began.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代・室町時代の間には本州の安東氏の影響下に置かれた（道南十二館・渡党参照）。
sen.e: Using this culture as a foothold, movement and settlement of Wajin began.(一原文During the Kamakura and Muromashi periods, southern end of Watari-shima was put under the influence of the Anto clan in Honshu.(cf. Juuni-yakata (twelve castles in southern Hokkaido and Watarito (migratory group)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Kamakura and Muromashi periods, southern end of Oshima Peninsula was put under the influence of the Ando clan in Honshu (Refer to Donan Juni Kan [12 castles of the Oshima Peninsula] and Watarito [migratory group].)
sen.cmt: 前部から重なった部分を削除しました。Watari-shima→Oshima Peninsula,Anto→Ando と修正しました。余分なピリオドを削除し、カッコ内のカッコ、スペースを修正しました。「渡党」の"migratory group"については確認が取れていませんが、御判断を仰ぎたくそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: During the Kamakura and Muromashi periods, southern end of Oshima Peninsula was put under the influence of the Ando clan in Honshu (Refer to Donan Juni Kan [12 castles of the Oshima Peninsula] and Watarito [migratory group].)

sen.j: 在地領主蛎崎氏改め松前氏は安東氏の配下であったが、豊臣秀吉に直接仕え安東氏から独立した。
sen.e: The lord in the area, the Matsumae clan, the former Kakizaki clan was originally under the Anto clan, but became independent of the Anto clan and worked directly under Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The lord in the area, the Matsumae clan, the former Kakizaki clan was originally under the Ando clan, but directly served for Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI., and became independent from the Ando clan.
sen.cmt: Anto→Ando,worked under→served for,of→from と修正しました。カンマを補い、オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: The lord in the area, the Matsumae clan, the former Kakizaki clan was originally under the Ando clan, but directly served for Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI., and became independent from the Ando clan.

sen.j: その後、徳川家康からアイヌ交易独占権を認められ、大名に列した。
sen.e: Afterwards, the Matsumae clan was approved by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA of the monopolistic trade right with the Ainu and ranked with daimyo (feudal lords).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, the Matsumae clan was approved by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA of the monopolistic trade right with the Ainu and ranked as daimyo (Japanese territorial lord).
sen.cmt: with→as と修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Afterwards, the Matsumae clan was approved by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA of the monopolistic trade right with the Ainu and ranked as daimyo (Japanese territorial lord).

sen.j: これにより松前藩が和人地を直接支配領域とし、あわせて蝦夷地との交易をも管理することになった。
sen.e: Due to this reason, the Matsumae clan placed Wajinchi under its direct control area, and besides, came to manage the trade with the Ezo area.
Due to this reason, the Matsumae clan placed Wajinchi under its direct control area, and besides, came to manage the trade with the Ezo area.
Due to this reason, the Matsumae clan placed Wajinchi under its direct control area, and besides, came to manage the trade with the Ezo area.

sen.j: 初期の松前藩の収入は、藩主・家臣ともにアイヌとの交易にあったため、松前藩は他の日本人とアイヌとの取引を禁止した。
sen.e: Revenue of the Matumae clan including the lord and retainers in its early days, was from the trade with Ainu, therefore, the Matsumae clan prohibited the trade between other Japanese and Ainu.
Revenue of the Matsumae clan including the lord and retainers in its early days, was from the trade with Ainu, therefore, the Matsumae clan prohibited the trade between other Japanese and Ainu.
Revenue of the Matsumae clan including the lord and retainers in its early days, was from the trade with Ainu, therefore, the Matsumae clan prohibited the trade between other Japanese and Ainu.

sen.j: その一環として、松前藩は和人地に境界を引き、東西の端に番所を置いて、和人地と蝦夷地の往来を取り締まった。
sen.e: As one part of that policy, the clan drew a boundary line in the Wajinchi, established guardhouses at both east and west ends, and supervised coming and going of people between Wajinchi and Ezo area.

As one part of that policy, the Matsumae clan drew a boundary line in the Wajinchi, established guardhouses at both east and west ends, and supervised coming and going of people between Wajinchi and Ezo area.

As one part of that policy, the Matsumae clan drew a boundary line in the Wajinchi, established guardhouses at both east and west ends, and supervised coming and going of people between Wajinchi and Ezo area.

sen.j: 日本人が蝦夷地に出ることは禁じられたが、アイヌが和人地に出ることは禁止されず、江戸時代の前半には、交易船を仕立てて和人地に出るアイヌも珍しくなかった。
sen.e: Although Japanese were prohibited to go to Ezo area, but Ainu were not prohibited to come to Wajinchi, and in the first half of Edo era, it was not rare that Ainus came to Wajinchi by preparing trade ships.

Although Japanese were prohibited to go to Ezo area, but Ainu were not prohibited to go to Wajinchi, and in the first half of Edo era, it was not rare that Ainus went to Wajinchi by preparing trade ships.

Although Japanese were prohibited to go to Ezo area, but Ainu were not prohibited to go to Wajinchi, and in the first half of Edo era, it was not rare that Ainus went to Wajinchi by preparing trade ships.

sen.j: 後に、和人地の鰊漁が慢性的不漁に陥ると、蝦夷地に日本人が漁労に出るようになった。
sen.e: In later years, when whale fishing fell in chronic poor catch, Japanese started to go to the Ezo area for fishing.
In later years, when the herring fishing fell to chronically poor catches in the Wajinch, Japanese started to go to the Ezo area for fishing.
sen.cmt: whale→herring と修正しました。文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: In later years, when the herring fishing fell to chronically poor catches in the Wajinch, Japanese started to go to the Ezo area for fishing.

sen.j: ただし、永年の居住はなお禁じられており季節の出稼ぎが主だったようである。
sen.e: However, living in the Ezo area for a long time was still prohibited for Japanese, and they seemed to stay there only for a limited time as migrant laborers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, living in the Ezo area for a long time was still prohibited for Japanese, and they seemed to stay there only as seasonal migrant laborers.
sen.cmt: for a limited times as→as seasonal と修正しました。
sen.e: However, living in the Ezo area for a long time was still prohibited for Japanese, and they seemed to stay there only as seasonal migrant laborers.

sen.j: しかし、18世紀の末頃から江戸幕府が蝦夷地の直接支配に乗り出し始めると次第に拡大し、東は1800年には野田追（のだおい、現八雲町）、1864年には同長万部（おしゃまんべ、現長万部町）など、後の胆振国山越郡にあたる地域に広がり、西では1865年に後の後志国小樽郡に相当する小樽内（おたるない、現小樽市）に達した。
sen.e: But after the end of 18th century, the Edo shogunate began to control directly the Ezo area, Wajinchi expanded gradually, and in the eastern area, the scope of Wajinchi reached Nodaoi (present Yakumo town) in 1800 and Oshamanbe (present Oshamanbe town, later Yamakoshi County, Kimofuri Province) in eastern area of Ezo in 1864, and within Otaru area corresponding to Otaru County, Goshi Province (present Otaru City) in western area in 1865.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But from the end of 18th century, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) began to control directly the Ezo area, Wajinchi expanded gradually, and in the eastern area, the scope of Wajinchi reached Nodaoi (present Yakumo town) in 1800, and Oshamanbe (present Oshamanbe town, later Yamakoshi County, Iburi Province) in eastern area of Ezo in 1864, and within Otaru area corresponding to later Otaru County, Goshi Province (present Otaru City) in western area in 1865.
sen.cmt: after→from,「江戸幕府」を修正しました。スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。Kimofuri→Iburi,later を補いました。
sen.e: But from the end of 18th century, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) began to control directly the Ezo area, Wajinchi expanded gradually, and in the eastern area, the scope of Wajinchi reached Nodaoi (present Yakumo town) in 1800, and Oshamanbe (present Oshamanbe town, later Yamakoshi County, Iburi Province) in eastern area of Ezo in 1864, and within Otaru area corresponding to later Otaru County, Goshi Province (present Otaru City) in western area in 1865.

sen.j: なお、末期の和人地に相当する地域には、後に北海道 (令制)11国86郡のうち下記の国郡が置かれた。
sen.e: In addition, in the area corresponding to the Wajinchi at the end of end of Edo period, the following provinces and counties were established among 11 provinces and 86 counties in Hokkaido (according to the system of Ritsuryo codes).

In addition, in the area corresponding to the Wajinchi at the end of its history, the following provinces and counties were established among 11 provinces and 86 counties which are later of Hokkaido (According to the system of Ritsuryo codes.)
sen.cmt: end of を削除しました。文脈より修正しました。カッコ部分とピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, in the area corresponding to the Wajinchi at the end of its history, the following provinces and counties were established among 11 provinces and 86 counties which are later of Hokkaido (According to the system of Ritsuryo codes.)
Oshiima Province
Oshiima Province
Oshiima Province
Shiribeshi Province
Shiribeshi Province
Shiribeshi Province

sen.j: 胆振国山越郡（山越郡以外は東蝦夷地）
sen.e: Yamagoe County, Iburi Province (eastern Ezo area excluding Ymagoe County)
Yamakoshi County, Iburi Province (eastern Ezo area excluding Yamakoshi County)
sen.cmt: 「山越郡」を確認し、修正しました。
sen.e: Yamakoshi County, Iburi Province (eastern Ezo area excluding Yamakoshi County)
